bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, December 14, 1928

div1.p: Carter plans on spending the Christmas holiday working on the manuscript at the Frost home in Baltimore.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, December 14, 1928
div1.opener:
Book, Misel.
Report (weekly)
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
December 14, 1928.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
I've been so busy this week, (a) getting ready for, (b) working with,
and (c) making Memoranda about, some final discussions with Dr. Morley,
that I haven't had time to report progress. I think, however, I've
done about three weeks work in the past seven days. I can send you
carbons, if you wish, but I doubt if you care to be cluttered up with
detail.

Dr. Frost has asked if I could spend the Xmas holidays working
with him in Baltimore, and Mrs. Frost has very kindly invited me to
stay at their house. Of course, I have accepted. I shlall try to
find time to write to you next week, but Miss Brown and I will be
so busy getting ready for my stay in Baltimore that I'm sure you'll
understand if you do not hear from me. Incidentally, Miss Brown
will use up the remainder of her annual leave next week working for me, so
that I won't be too tired from night work to properly co-operate with
Dr. Frost. I wouldn't accept this for myself, but for the book, I
am doing so gratefully, as I am her work to-morrow night and Sunday.
div1.closer:
With very best wishes, I remain
Most truly yours, Laura A. Carter Dr. Frederick F. Russell, Director,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
